availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert M. Bradley (Somerset, Pulaski County, attorney)

body.p: Somerset, Pulaski County, attorney. Kentucky native. Married Nancy Ellen Totten Bradley in Garrard, Kentucky on December 8, 1833. Father of Mary E. Bradley, Amanda P. Bradley, Margaret E. Bradley, Celia V. Bradley, Martha J. Bradley, and William O. Bradley. Attorney in Boyle County, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Somerset, Pulaski County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Somerset, Pulaski County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 2, p. 720. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, p. 152. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, p. 195. Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Gerrard County Marriages, Film #000183256, p. 23. Find A Grave, "Robert McAffee Bradley (March 22, 1808- August 31, 1881)," Memorial #8889044, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8889044 (accessed May 22, 2019).
